text.0: where is famed indra heard of with what folk is he renowned today as mitra is.
text.1: who in the home of Ṛṣis and in secret is extolled with song.
text.2: even here is indra famed and among us this day the glorious thunderer is praised.
text.3: he who like mitra mid the folk hath won complete and full renown.
text.4: he who is sovran lord of great and perfect strength exerter of heroic might.
text.5: who bears the fearless thunder as a father bears his darling son.
text.6: harnessing to thy car as god two blustering steeds of the windgod o thunderer.
text.7: that speed along the shining path thou making ways art glorified.
text.8: even to these dark steeds of wind thou of thyself hast come to ride.
text.9: of which no driver may be found none be he god or mortal man.
text.10: when ye approach men ask you thee and uśanā why come ye to our dwellingplace.
text.11: why are ye come to mortal man from distant realms of eapth and heaven.
text.12: o indra thou shalt speak us fair our holy prayer is offered up.
text.13: we pray to thee for help as thou didst strike the monster Śuṣṇa dead.
text.14: around us is the dasyu riteless void of sense inhuman keeping alien laws.
text.15: baffle thou slayer of the foe the weapon which this dāsa wields.
text.16: hero with heroes thou art ours yea strong are they whom thou dost help.
text.17: in many a place are thy full gifts and men like vassals sing thy praise.
text.18: urge thou these heroes on to slay the enemy brave thunderer in the fight with swords.
text.19: even when hid among the tribes of sages numerous as stars.
text.20: swift come those gifts of thine whose hand is prompt to rend and burn o hero thunderarmed.
text.21: as thou with thy companions didst destroy the whole of susnias brood.
text.22: let not thine excellent assistance come to us o hero indra profitless.
text.23: may we may we enjoy the bliss of these thy favours thunderer.
text.24: may those soft impulses of thine o indra be fruitful and innocent to us.
text.25: may we know these whose treasures are like those of milchkine thunderer.
text.26: that earth through power of knowing things that may be known handless and footless yet might thrive.
text.27: thou slewest turning to the right guna for every living man.
text.28: drink drink the soma hero indra be not withheld as thou art good o treasuregiver.
text.29: preserve the singers and our liberal princes and make us wealthy with abundant riches.
